document_data.name: Cothra
document_data.mainbody: '''Cothra''' was a [[priestess]] of [[Bane]] active in the [[Thayan]] city of [[Bezantur]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities:
Cothra was the high priestess overseeing the [[Temple of Bane (Bezantur)|Temple of Bane]] in Bezantur following Bane's death in the [[Time of Troubles]]. As such, her main role was to ensure the temple was kept clean and to lead the remaining priests in services praying for the return of their [[god]].

As the leader of the temple in Bezantur, Cothra was at the top of the hierarchy of the Thayan [[church of Bane]].
document_data.History: Cothra assumed control of the temple sometime after the {{YearlinkName|1357}}. By the late 1360s DR, although she publicly venerated Bane and prayed for his return, she also worshiped [[Iyachtu Xvim]], who was the source of her [[Divine magic|spells]].
